content: A large hospital is evaluating the efficiency of its emergency department (ED). On average, the ED receives 500 patients per day, with a peak hour volume of 60 patients. Each patient requires an average of 30 minutes of care from medical staff. The hospital aims to reduce waiting times by increasing the number of available doctors and nurses during peak hours. Determine the minimum number of additional medical staff required to achieve this goal, assuming that each doctor or nurse works an 8-hour shift and spends 75% of their time providing direct patient care.

So, total staff required = 30 hours / 0.75 hours per staff per hour = 40 staff.
